frame.name: Emotions_success_or_failure
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Topic</fen> or <fen>Stimulus</fen> fails or succeeds at causing an emotion in an <fen>Experiencer</fen>, which is conveyed by an <fen>Expressor</fen> or manifested in a <fen>State</fen> or description of an <fen>Event</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
</def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Stimulus
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. </def-root>

FE.name: Empathy_target
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Empathy_target</fen> is the individual or individuals with which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response. </def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
</def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Reason</fen> is the explanation for why the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes a certain emotional response. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> is the condition(s) under which the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit <fen>Stimulus</fen>. Quite often in such cases, the <fen>Stimulus</fen> can be inferred from the <fen>Circumstances</fen> </def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
</def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the way in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). <fen>Manner</fen> may also describe a state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that affects the details of the emotional experience.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, <fen>Expressor</fen>, <fen>Event</fen>, or <fen>State</fen> can be described as having said emotion.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of times the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the emotion.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: unfulfilled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: a feeling of not being fulfilled.

lexUnit.name: fulfilled.a
lexUnit.definition: Fn: fully realized or at maximum potential
